definition: to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
"speech" or "words" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 149)/see also 言字旁[yan2 zi4 pang2]
to cash/to exchange/to add (liquid)/to blend/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing swamp/☱
to explain/to illustrate/to indicate/to show/to prove/explanation/directions/caption/CL:個|个[ge4]
to speak/to say/to talk/to gossip/to tell stories/talk/word
to hear (sth said)/one hears (that)/hearsay/listening and speaking
in other words/that is to say/so/thus
It is said that ... (at the start of a narrative)/to discuss/to recount
legend/folklore/to repeat from mouth to mouth/they say that...

sentences.english: Still, who are we to say that we can stay?
sentences.chinese: 然而，谁有敢说我们能长留此地？

sentences.english: Other violence occurred at Friendship Road and at Liberation Road, they said.
sentences.chinese: 他们说还有其它的暴力事件发生在友谊路和解放大道。

sentences.english: "I'm so glad to see you, " said Carrie, pleased and yet nonplussed.
sentences.chinese: “看见你我太高兴了，”嘉莉说，既高兴又为难。

sentences.english: "More than any other subject, weight is delicate, " Maddison said.
sentences.chinese: “体重问题比其他问题都要微妙，”麦迪逊说。

sentences.english: I believed that the mixture of religion and politics was dangerous.
sentences.chinese: 意思是说政教合一是非常危险的。
“晚安”伊娃说，她搬起另一把椅子。

sentences.english: After the meeting, I will you, I very well.
sentences.chinese: 经年相遇，我会对你说，我很好。

sentences.english: Kangkang said that he previewed the day's lesson before class.
sentences.chinese: 康康说他课前预习当天的课程。

sentences.english: They said the targe was out of reach.
sentences.chinese: 他们抱怨说这个目标无法达成。

sentences.english: 'Madame has gone to Paris, ' Nanine answered.
sentences.chinese: “太太到巴黎去了，”纳尼娜回答我说。

sentences.english: Russia says that Iran and North Korea do not have missiles capable of striking Europe.
sentences.chinese: 俄罗斯说，伊朗和北韩没有掌握可以打击欧洲的导弹。

sentences.english: Rather he'll say, "It's for the child's own good.
sentences.chinese: 而是说，“这都是为了孩子好。

sentences.english: There aring a lot of secrets in the man heart can't say literally that let wife listen to.
sentences.chinese: 男人心中有好多秘密不能随便说给妻子听。

sentences.english: Sometimes a lack of information can lead workers to misperceive that there's preferential treatment, says Mr. Reed.
sentences.chinese: 里德说，有时候信息的缺乏会让员工误以为老板偏心。

sentences.english: Nathan noted that the study can't prove that smoking causes diabetes.
sentences.chinese: 内森说此项研究不能证明吸烟会导致糖尿病。

sentences.english: Zhu told a group of us.
sentences.chinese: 朱先生对着我们一群人说到。

definition: to press charges/to file a complaint
to speak/to explain/to negotiate/to emphasise/to be particular about/as far as sth is concerned/speech/lecture
he or him/(used for either sex when the sex is unknown or unimportant)/(used before sb's name for emphasis)/(used as a meaningless mock object)/other/another
to know/to become aware of/also pr. [zhi1 dao5]

at once/right away/only/just (emphasis)/as early as/already/as soon as/then/in that case/as many as/even if/to approach/to move towards/to undertake/to engage in/to suffer/subjected to/to accomplish/to take advantage of/to go with (of foods)/with regard to/concerning
interjection or grunt of agreement/uhm/Ah, OK/expression of recognition/Oh, it's you!
modal particle ending sentence, showing affirmation, approval, or consent
interjection expressing doubt or requiring answer/Eh?/what?
interjection of surprise or doubt/Eh?/My!/what's up?
